oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grafted into the Army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Six-page sheet music entitled "Grafted into the Army." On the front cover is a mother holding a pair of torn trousers. Below is a young soldier walking picket duty.

Henry Clay Work (1832-1884) was an American songwriter and publisher. Before the war, he was an ardent abolitionist and Union supporter. A self-taught musician, he composed several popular songs. He is known as the "war poet." Root and Cady was a famous music publishing company based in Chicago. The company went out of business in 1871.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Work, Henry C. (Henry Clay), 1832-1884
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Root and Cady; Work, Henry C. (Henry Clay), 1832-1884
Sheet music covers; Music title pages; Music publishing industry; Songs; Patriotism
